sentence.Network_en: Three burly toughs elbowed their way to the front.
sentence.Network_cn: 三个膀粗腰圆的恶汉挤到了前面。

sentence.Network_en: The burly brute swaggered forward, towering over me, and shouted.
sentence.Network_cn: 五大三粗的恶汉趾高气扬地走过来，居高临下地对我咆哮着。

sentence.Network_en: No one expects him to get involved in the hurly-burly of campaigning.
sentence.Network_cn: 谁也没有料到他会加入到乱哄哄的竞选活动。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'dignified, imposing'): probably from an unrecorded Old English  word meaning 'stately, fit for the bower' (see bower, -ly)

entry.def: A burly man has a broad body and strong muscles.

example.ex: He was a big, burly man.
